revised_title: Radio Observations of Molecules in Interstellar Space
tldr: The article discusses the discovery of nearly 50 molecules in interstellar gas through radio observations. It explains that most interstellar molecules are stable compounds, but some are ions, radicals, and reactive carbon chains. The heavy atom backbone of these molecules is a linear chain, and they are mainly observed in rotational transitions at millimeter wavelengths. The molecular clouds where these molecules are found play a central role in star formation and galactic structure.
